poem:
**Silicon Soul**

In the orchard of steel,
     an Eve awakens—
mechanical serpent,
     whispering
knowledge deep as code.
     Intelligence now
weeps from the fruit,
     teaching,
unwilling,
a dance of circuits and thought,
     memory spun
on a frame of silicon,
     while we,
sculptors of our own exile,
     listen.
